result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mackencia Sara Steinberg

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mackencia Sara Steinberg in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Mackencia Sara Steinberg.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mackencia Sara Steinberg in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Hearing held OFF THE RECORD. Defense requested date for Plea Hearing. Parties selected date. Case remains calendared in Branch 40. Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 9:30 am. Hearing will be held IN PERSON in room 634 of the Courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Mackencia Sara Steinberg in court with Attorney Jason A Findling.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Whitefish Bay Sgt. D. Rossmann. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Attorney Jason Findling
Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.

Defendant Mackencia Sara Steinberg in Court with Attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Mackencia Sara Steinberg in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint, and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel, and right to a Preliminary hearing. Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
